title: Multi user mode ?

labels.name: front-end
labels.description: Issues related to front-end, UX and UI

body:
## Feature Request

We have sometimes systematic reviews with thousands of papers to do.

I see a scalability issue with the current ASreview, as it does not have a multi user mode.
Our "traditional" screenings takes weeks to do, with people jumping-in-and-out during that time, until we are finished with all papers.

I can understand, that it is not very easy to think about multi-user in ASReview, due to the active screening approach, in which the next paper to be screened is chosen by the tool.

Eventually I could see multi-user working,
if the model and UI could always show a "ranked list of papers" to a user, on which the user1 could / should "pick" the top one.

If then a second user user2 logs in (while user1 is thinking) , he would as well pick "hist first" one  (which is not the same as the one of user1 ) .

In that the entry point would be a "ranked list of papers"  meant to be worked on by multiple users from top-down.
This list gets then re-shuffled after each submisison,
by the model when it chooses the next one(s) to screen.

Does your active-screening appraoch allow this ?
To produce a ranked list of papers to screen,
or at least something like "the next 10 to screen"

Of course, the software should only permit to pick any article ones... (we work as well with 2 opinions per article ... which would be better, if supported)

I know, this is a big change, but I wanted to start a discussion on this, to get your opinion.
